column2: DELAWARE PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Delaware
column6: DE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column6: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 2. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 3. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.
column6: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column8: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.

column2: 4. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
column6: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 5. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Stop and wait for the green light
column6: Stop and yield the right of way.
column8: You have the right-of-way.

column2: 6. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column4: look farther ahead.
column6: drive with both hands on steering wheel.
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: Reversible lane ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: The divided highway ends ahead.

column2: 8. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: come to a complete stop, then proceed.
column6: maintain your normal speed.
column8: slow and proceed with caution.

column2: 9. You arrive at an intersection where you have a green light, but the path ahead is blocked, you should:
column4: stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
column6: turn left and find another route.
column8: enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.

column2: 10. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 11. Speed limit signs are:
column4: service signs
column6: regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: warning signs

column2: 12. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective orange triangle
column6: A reflective yellow diamond
column8: A reflective white triangle

column2: 13. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

column2: 14. Which of the following road surfaces freezes first when wet?
column4: Tunnels.
column6: Bridges and overpasses.
column8: Roundabouts.

column2: 15. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
column6: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column8: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.

column2: 16. Children under the age of 16:
column4: may be restrained at their parents' discretion.
column6: must be restrained only when driving on highways.
column8: must be restrained at all times.

column2: 17. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column6: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 18. Which of the following is a common cause of traffic collisions?
column4: Scanning the road ahead and staying focused on the driving task.
column6: Pedestrians being key participants in the transportation system.
column8: Driving too fast for conditions.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead
column6: Road construction ahead
column8: The road ahead curves right, then left

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: Divided highway ends.

column2: 21. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column6: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column8: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Do not use your brakes in this area
column6: Warning, curves ahead
column8: Slippery when wet

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Intersection ahead
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 24. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.
column6: when it stops raining.
column8: just before it rains.

column2: 25. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: a divided highway ends ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 26. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 27. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 28. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 29. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 30. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: signal.
column8: All of the above.
